data.chText: 效应；影响；结果
data.enText: a change that sb/sth causes in sb/sth else; a result

data.chText: 热对金属产生的效应
data.enText: the effect of heat on metal

data.chText: 引人注目的影响；长期效应
data.enText: dramatic/long-term effects

data.chText: 学会分清因果
data.enText: to learn to distinguish between cause and effect

data.chText: 锻炼的好处
data.enText: the beneficial effects of exercise

data.chText: 现代农业耕作方法可能对环境造成负面影响。
data.enText: Modern farming methods can have an adverse effect on the environment.

data.chText: 她批评的结果是使他完全丧失了信心。
data.enText: Her criticisms had the effect of discouraging him completely.

data.chText: 她尽管备受磨难，但好像并未受到不利影响。
data.enText: Despite her ordeal, she seems to have suffered no ill effects .

data.chText: 我当然能感受到熬夜太多产生的影响。
data.enText: I can certainly feel the effects of too many late nights.

data.chText: “我真感到抑郁。”“这儿的冬天有时候就会产生这种影响。”
data.enText: ‘I'm feeling really depressed.’ ‘The winter here has that effect sometimes.’

data.chText: 我试图说服他，但却无济于事。
data.enText: I tried to persuade him, but with little or no effect.

data.chText: （艺术家或作家所要创造的特定）外观，声响，印象，效果
data.enText: a particular look, sound or impression that sb, such as an artist or a writer, wants to create

data.chText: 这幅画的总体效果气势磅礡。
data.enText: The overall effect of the painting is overwhelming.

data.chText: 舞台灯光产生出月下景色的效果。
data.enText: The stage lighting gives the effect of a moonlit scene.

data.chText: 再围上一条围巾以显得随便些。
data.enText: Add a scarf for a casual effect.

data.chText: 他那样表现不过是为了哗众取宠。
data.enText: He only behaves like that for effect (= in order to impress people) .

data.chText: （个人）财产，所有物，财物
data.enText: your personal possessions

data.chText: 这份保险单为全部行李和个人财产提供保险。
data.enText: The insurance policy covers all baggage and personal effects.
bring/put sth into effect

data.chText: 使生效；实行；实施
data.enText: to cause sth to come into use

data.chText: 这些建议即将付诸实施。
data.enText: The recommendations will soon be put into effect.
come into effect

data.chText: 生效；开始实施
data.enText: to come into use; to begin to apply

data.chText: 下月开始实施新的管制措施。
data.enText: New controls come into effect next month.
in effect

data.chText: 实际上；事实上
data.enText: used when you are stating what the facts of a situation are

data.chText: 实际上，这两种系统完全一样。
data.enText: In effect, the two systems are identical.

data.chText: 过去的六个月实际上是他的妻子在执政。
data.enText: His wife had, in effect, run the government for the past six months.

data.chText: 在实施中；有效
data.enText: in use

data.chText: 这些法律在二十个州有效。
data.enText: These laws are in effect in twenty states.
take effect

data.chText: 开始起作用；见效
data.enText: to start to produce the results that are intended

data.chText: 阿司匹林药片很快见效。
data.enText: The aspirins soon take effect.

data.chText: 生效；开始实施
data.enText: to come into use; to begin to apply

data.chText: 新法令明日起生效。
data.enText: The new law takes effect from tomorrow.
to the effect that…
to this/that effect

data.chText: 大意是；意思是；有这个（或那个）意思
data.enText: used to show that you are giving the general meaning of what sb has said or written rather than the exact words

data.chText: 他留下一张字条，大意是他不回来了。
data.enText: He left a note to the effect that he would not be coming back.

data.chText: 她叫我滚开——或说了类似的话。
data.enText: She told me to get out─or words to that effect .
to good, great, dramatic, etc. effect

data.chText: 富有成效；效果良好
data.enText: producing a good, successful, dramatic, etc. result or impression
to no effect

data.chText: 毫无效果；毫无成效；不起作用
data.enText: not producing the result you intend or hope for

data.chText: 我们曾告诫过他们，但没起任何作用。
data.enText: We warned them, but to no effect.
with immediate effect
with effect from…

data.chText: 立即生效；从…起开始生效
data.enText: starting now; starting from…

data.chText: 政府已削减利率，从下月起开始生效。
data.enText: The government has cut interest rates with effect from the beginning of next month.

data.chText: 使发生；实现；引起
data.enText: to make sth happen

data.chText: 产生疗效；引起变化；实现复苏
data.enText: to effect a cure/change/recovery

data.chText: 以上各词均表示结果。
data.enText: These are all words for a thing that is caused because of sth else.
effect

data.chText: 指对人 / 事产生的效应、影响、结果：
data.enText: a change in sb/sth that is caused by sb/sth else

data.chText: 她的批评使他完全丧失了信心。
data.enText: Her criticisms had the effect of discouraging him completely.
result

data.chText: 指后果、结果：
data.enText: a thing that is caused or produced by sth else

data.chText: 她由于受伤而死亡。
data.enText: She died as a result of her injuries.

data.chText: 这本书是25年研究的结晶。
data.enText: This book is the result of 25 years of research.
consequence

data.chText: 尤指不好的结果、后果：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) a result of sth that has happened, especially a bad result

data.chText: 这项决定可能会对该行业产生严重后果。
data.enText: This decision could have serious consequences for the industry.

data.chText: consequence最常用以指可能产生的负面结果，常与adverse、dire、disastrous、fatal、harmful、negative、serious、tragic、unfortunate等词连用。即使没有形容词修饰，consequence也常含负面结果之意。
data.enText: Consequences is used most frequently to talk about possible negative results of an action. It is commonly used with such words as adverse , dire , disastrous , fatal , harmful , negative , serious , tragic and unfortunate . Even when there is no adjective, consequences often suggests negative results.
outcome

data.chText: 指行动或过程的结果、效果：
data.enText: the result of an action or process

data.chText: 我们在等待谈判的最终结果。
data.enText: We are waiting to hear the final outcome of the negotiations.

data.chText: 用result还是outcome？
result常指直接引致的结果：
data.enText: Result is often used to talk about things that are caused directly by sth else.

data.chText: 好斗情绪通常是害怕所致。
data.enText: Aggression is often the result of fear.

data.chText: outcome较常指某一过程完结时的结果，原因和结果之间的关系已不太明显：
data.enText: Outcome is more often used to talk about what happens at the end of a process when the exact relation of cause and effect is less clear.
Aggresssion is often the outcome of fear.

data.chText: result常用于事情过去之后的结果，outcome常用于谈及行动或过程可能会产生的结果。
data.enText: Result is often used after an event to talk about what happened. Outcome is often used before an action or process to talk about what is likely to happen.
result or outcome?
repercussion

data.chText: 指行动或事情过去之后可能产生的间接而常为负面的影响、反响
data.enText: ( rather formal ) an indirect and usually bad result of an action or event that may happen some time afterwards
to have consequences/repercussions for sb/sth
with the effect/result/consequence/outcome that…
a(n)/the possible/likely/inevitable effect/result/consequences/outcome/repercussions
(a/an) dramatic/far-reaching/serious/negative effect/results/consequences/outcome/repercussions
(a) lasting effect/result/consequences/repercussions
the final result/outcome
the end result
to have an effect/a result/consequences/an outcome/repercussions
to achieve/get/obtain a(n) effect/result/outcome

data.chText: affect动词 = 影响某人 / 某事：
data.enText: affect verb = ‘to have an influence on sb/sth’

data.chText: 电视对孩子的行为有影响吗？
data.enText: Does television affect children’s behaviour?

data.chText: 该词不作名词。
data.enText: It is not a noun.

data.chText: effect名词 = 作用；影响：
data.enText: effect noun = ‘result, influence’

data.chText: 电视对孩子的行为有影响吗？
data.enText: Does television have an effect on children’s behaviour?

data.chText: effect作动词罕见且正式，意为实现、产生：
data.enText: effect verb is quite rare and formal and means ‘to achieve or produce’

data.chText: 他们希望实现和解。
data.enText: They hope to effect a reconciliation.

simple_means.memory_skill: ef〔= e 加强〕+ fect 做，制作 → 反复做 → 实施

means: (艺术家或作家所要创造的特定)外观，声响，印象，效果

ex.chText: 是什么原因使汤姆辞职的?
ex.enText: What caused Tom to quit his job?

ex.chText: 他们的痛苦引起了我们的同情。
这也许会引起他对这些学科的兴趣。
ex.enText: It may arouse his interest in these subjects.

synonyms.bx: 指引起某种情感、态度等。

ex.chText: 成功给这位老人带来了极大的满足感。
ex.enText: The success brought the old man great satisfaction.

synonyms.bx: 指导致某种情况或某种情感产生。

ex.chText: 新经理使公司发生了巨大的变化。
ex.enText: The new manager effected great changes in the firm.

synonyms.bx: 指引发某事，强调产生的效果。

data.enText: bring/put sth into effect

data.chText: 使生效；实行；实施
data.enText: to cause sth to come into use

data.chText: 这些建议即将付诸实施。
data.enText: The recommendations will soon be put into effect.
come into effect

data.chText: 生效；开始实施
data.enText: to come into use; to begin to apply

data.chText: 下月开始实施新的管制措施。
data.enText: New controls come into effect next month.
in effect

data.chText: 实际上；事实上
data.enText: used when you are stating what the facts of a situation are

data.chText: 实际上，这两种系统完全一样。
data.enText: In effect, the two systems are identical.

data.chText: 过去的六个月实际上是他的妻子在执政。
data.enText: His wife had, in effect, run the government for the past six months.

data.chText: 在实施中；有效
data.enText: in use

data.chText: 这些法律在二十个州有效。
data.enText: These laws are in effect in twenty states.
take effect

data.chText: 开始起作用；见效
data.enText: to start to produce the results that are intended

data.chText: 阿司匹林药片很快见效。
data.enText: The aspirins soon take effect.

data.chText: 生效；开始实施
data.enText: to come into use; to begin to apply

data.chText: 新法令明日起生效。
data.enText: The new law takes effect from tomorrow.
to the effect that…
to this/that effect

data.chText: 大意是；意思是；有这个（或那个）意思
data.enText: used to show that you are giving the general meaning of what sb has said or written rather than the exact words

data.chText: 他留下一张字条，大意是他不回来了。
data.enText: He left a note to the effect that he would not be coming back.

data.chText: 她叫我滚开——或说了类似的话。
data.enText: She told me to get out─or words to that effect .
to good, great, dramatic, etc. effect

data.chText: 富有成效；效果良好
data.enText: producing a good, successful, dramatic, etc. result or impression
to no effect

data.chText: 毫无效果；毫无成效；不起作用
data.enText: not producing the result you intend or hope for

data.chText: 我们曾告诫过他们，但没起任何作用。
data.enText: We warned them, but to no effect.
with immediate effect
with effect from…

data.chText: 立即生效；从…起开始生效
data.enText: starting now; starting from…

data.chText: 政府已削减利率，从下月起开始生效。
data.enText: The government has cut interest rates with effect from the beginning of next month.

example: I wanted to create an impression of success
she retained that bold effect in her reproductions of the original painting
the law is still in effect

tr: an impression (especially one that is artificial or contrived)
example: he just did it for effect

tr: the central meaning or theme of a speech or literary work
a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon
example: the magnetic effect was greater when the rod was lengthwise
his decision had depressing consequences for business
he acted very wise after the event

tr: a symptom caused by an illness or a drug

example: The scientists set up a shock wave

tr: act so as to bring into existence

value.def: The effect of one thing on another is the change that the first thing causes in the second thing.

example.ex: Parents worry about the effect of music on their adolescent's behavior...
example.tran: 父母担心音乐对青春期孩子的行为所产生的影响。

example.ex: The austerity measures will have little immediate adverse effect on the average Moroccan...
example.tran: 财政紧缩政策不会对普通的摩洛哥人产生直接的负面影响。

example.ex: Even minor head injuries can cause long-lasting psychological effects.
example.tran: 即使是轻微的头部创伤也会对心理产生长期影响。

gramarinfo.label: oft N <l>of/on</l> n, N <l>of</l> -ing, adj N

value.def: An effect is an impression that someone creates deliberately, for example in a place or in a piece of writing.

example.ex: The whole effect is cool, light and airy.
example.tran: 整体效果很酷，轻松而随意。

value.def: A person's effects are the things that they have with them at a particular time, for example when they are arrested or admitted to hospital, or the things that they owned when they died.

example.ex: His daughters were collecting his effects.
example.tran: 他的女儿们当时正在整理他的遗物。

value.def: The effects in a film are the specially created sounds and scenery.
If you effect something that you are trying to achieve, you succeed in causing it to happen.

example.ex: Prospects for effecting real political change seemed to have taken a major step backwards.
example.tran: 实现真正政治变革的机会似乎变得更加渺茫了。

xrsa.xrsa_see: greenhouse effect;placebo effect;ripple effect;side-effect;sound effect;special effect

value.boxu_tran: 注意动词 affect 和名词 effect 有关。可以说某件事影响了某人，用 affect，例如，Noise affects different people in different ways (噪音对不同的人会产生不同的影响）。也可以说某事对某人有影响，用 have an effect on，例如，the effect that noise has on people in factories （噪音对工厂里的人们产生的影响）。
value.boxu_usage: Note that the verb affect is connected with the noun effect. You can say that something affects you. Noise affects different people in different ways. You can also say that something has an effect on you ...the effect that noise has on people in factories.

value.def: If you say that someone is doing something for effect, you mean that they are doing it in order to impress people and to draw attention to themselves.

example.ex: Jock paused for effect, his eyes glinting over his glass as he took another drink...
example.tran: 乔克为了制造效果停下来又喝了口酒，他的眼睛在酒杯上方光芒闪烁。

example.ex: The Cockney accent was put on for effect.
example.tran: 这伦敦腔是为了给人以深刻印象而故意装出来的。

value.tran: 为了给人印象;为了吸引注意力

value.def: You add in effect to a statement or opinion that is not precisely accurate, but which you feel is a reasonable description or summary of a particular situation.

example.ex: That deal would create, in effect, the world's biggest airline.
example.tran: 事实上，这一协议将促成世界最大航空公司的成立。

value.def: If you put ,bring, or carry a plan or idea into effect, you cause it to happen in practice.

example.ex: These and other such measures ought to have been put into effect in 1985.
example.tran: 这些以及其他类似的措施在1985年就应该开始实施了。

example.ex: ...a decree bringing into effect the political reforms adopted last month.
example.tran: 上个月正式通过的实施政治改革的法令

value.def: If a law or policy takes effect or comes into effect at a particular time, it officially begins to apply or be valid from that time. If it remains in effect, it still applies or is still valid.

example.ex: ...the ban on new logging permits which will take effect from July...
example.tran: 将于7月生效的禁止颁发新伐木许可证的禁令

example.ex: The decision was taken yesterday and will remain in effect until further government instructions.
example.tran: 该决定于昨天作出，在政府未有进一步指示前将一直有效。

value.def: You can say that something takes effect when it starts to produce the results that are intended.

example.ex: The second injection should only have been given once the first drug had taken effect...
example.tran: 只有第一剂药见效后才可进行第二次注射。

example.ex: International sanctions were beginning to take effect.
example.tran: 国际制裁开始起作用了。

value.def: You use effect in expressions such as to good effect and to no effect in order to indicate how successful or impressive an action is.

example.ex: Mr Morris feels the museum is using advertising to good effect...
example.tran: 莫里斯先生认为博物馆作的广告卓有成效。

example.ex: Mr Charles complained, to no effect.
example.tran: 查尔斯先生投诉无果。

value.tran: 产生良好效果/毫无成效

value.def: You use to this effect ,to that effect, or to the effect that to indicate that you have given or are giving a summary of something that was said or written, and not the actual words used.

example.ex: A circular to this effect will be issued in the next few weeks...
example.tran: 接下来的几周内将发布一份大意如此的通告。

example.ex: Legislation to that effect created fierce controversy both in Parliament and outside...
example.tran: 那类立法在议会内外都引起了激烈的争论。

example.ex: He cited a Chinese proverb to the effect that you should never wish ill on your neighbour.
example.tran: 他引用了一个中国谚语，大意是不应对邻居心存恶念之类的。

value.def: If you say that something will happen with immediate effect or with effect from a particular time, you mean that it will begin to apply or be valid immediately or from the stated time.

example.ex: We are now resuming relations with Syria with immediate effect...
example.tran: 我们即刻起与叙利亚恢复关系。

example.ex: The price of the Saturday edition is going up with effect from 3 November.
example.tran: 自11月3日起，周六版价格将上调。

trans: 积极的影响；正面影响；积极作用；积极效果；正向效应
(药物的)副作用；意外的连带后果
无效；无货物（存款，财产）；缩写词为NE, N/E
经济效益，利用效果；经济效应
处理效应；处置效应；有疗效的；治疗效果；治疗效应
保护效应；保护作用；防治作用；防护效应；溶胶的保护作用

queryExplainVideo.detail: Affect vs effect 区别是什么？

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to do, to make 做, 制作
rootsaffixes.title: fac, fact, feas, fect, fic(i), fig

partsOfSpeech.dec: af 加强 + fect 做，制作 → 促使别人做 → 影响
affect 影响；感动 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 做出来的 → 假装
bene 好 + fact 做，制作 + ion 表名词 → 善事；恩惠
bene 善，好 + fact 做，制作 + or 表人 → 捐助者；恩人
de 坏 + fect 做，制作 → 做得不好 → 缺点
de 坏 + fect 做，制作 + ion 表名词 → 做的是坏事 → 背信
ef〔= e 加强〕+ fect 做，制作 → 反复做 → 实施
effect 实施；效果 + uate 使… → 使…有效
ef + fic 做，制作 + acious 有…性质的 → 做了有效果 → 有效应的
ef + fic 做，制作 + acy 加强 → 功效，功能
ef + fici 做，制作 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → （做事）有效率的
fac 做，制作 + ile 能…的 → 容易做的
facil〔e〕容易做的 + it + ate 使… → 使容易
facil〔e〕容易做的 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 用来做的东西 → 便利设备
fac 做，制作 + simil 相同 + e → 制作相同的东西 → 复写
fac 做，制作 + tion 表名词 →〔一帮人一起〕做 → 小集团
fact 做，制作 + itious …的 →〔人〕做出来的 → 人为的；不自然的
fact 做，制作 + or 表情况 → 促使人做 → 动力
feas 做，制作 + ible 可…的 → 能做的 → 可行的
fict + ion 表名词 → 造出的〔故事〕→ 小说
fig 做，制作 + ment 具体物 → 做出的东西 → 虚构的事物
in 进入 + fect 做，制作 → 做进去 → 传染
infect 传染；感化 + ious …的 → 传染性的
mal 坏 + fact 做，制作 + ion 表名词 → 坏作为 → 犯罪
mal 坏，恶 + feas 做，制作 + ance 表性质 → 做坏事 → 不法行为
manu 手 + fact 做，制作 + ure 行为 → 用手做 → 制造
per 贯穿 + fect 做，制作 → 全部贯穿 → 完全的
pro 在前 + fic 做，制作 + ient …的 → 之前做过 → 熟练的
pro 在前 + fit〔= fict 做，制作〕→ 在别人之前做〔才会有利益〕→ 利润
sacri 神圣 + fic 做，制作 + e →〔甘愿〕做神圣的事 → 牺牲
suf 下 + fic 做，制作 + e → 在下面提前做好 → 使满足
